research_projects.title: BIM and Game Engine Integration
research_projects.description: This research focuses on developing innovative frameworks for integrating Building Information Modeling (BIM) with game engines to enhance visualization and simulation capabilities in the AEC industry. The project explores real-time rendering, interactive environments, and immersive experiences for construction professionals.
research_projects.detailed_description: The project addresses the growing need for advanced visualization and simulation tools in the Architecture, Engineering, and Construction (AEC) industry. By leveraging the power of modern game engines such as Unity 3D and Unreal Engine, we are developing seamless integration protocols that allow BIM data to be visualized and manipulated in real-time interactive environments. This integration enables construction professionals to experience buildings and infrastructure projects in immersive virtual environments before physical construction begins.
objectives: Develop seamless data exchange protocols between BIM and game engines
Create interactive visualization tools for construction planning
Implement real-time simulation capabilities for construction processes
Design user-friendly interfaces for AEC professionals
Establish performance benchmarks for BIM-game engine integration
Validate the framework through industry case studies
outcomes: Published in Journal of Computational Design and Engineering (Q1, IF: 4.8)
publications: Advancing BIM and game engine integration in the AEC industry: innovations, challenges, and future directions (2025)
A tentative framework for discrete event simulation of modular building production using game engines (2024)
challenges: Large file size handling in real-time environments
Maintaining BIM data integrity during conversion
User interface design for non-technical users
research_projects.impact: High - Potential to revolutionize construction visualization and planning processes

research_projects.title: AI-Driven Design Recommender System
research_projects.description: Development of an intelligent design recommendation system using natural language processing and machine learning to assist architects and designers in creating client-centered modular housing solutions.
research_projects.detailed_description: This project addresses the challenge of translating client requirements into architectural designs by developing an AI-powered recommendation system. The system uses advanced natural language processing (NLP) techniques to analyze client descriptions and preferences, then generates tailored design recommendations for modular housing. The system incorporates machine learning algorithms trained on extensive design databases and client satisfaction data.
objectives: Process client requirements using advanced NLP techniques
Generate personalized design recommendations based on client preferences
Implement machine learning algorithms for design pattern recognition
Create intuitive user interface for design exploration and customization
Develop feedback system for continuous learning and improvement
Validate system effectiveness through user studies
outcomes: Published in Journal of Computational Design and Engineering (Corresponding author)
Achieved 85% client satisfaction rate in user studies
Created comprehensive design database with 500+ modular designs
publications: Client-centered detached modular housing: Natural language processing-enabled design recommender system (2024)
Office building design recommendations systems tailored to client needs (2023)
challenges: Balancing design creativity with technical constraints
Real-time processing of complex design parameters
research_projects.impact: Medium-High - Streamlines design process and improves client satisfaction

research_projects.title: Mixed Reality for Modular Construction
research_projects.description: Exploration of virtual reality applications in construction education and training, focusing on safety protocols and skill development for construction workers.
research_projects.detailed_description: This project investigated the potential of virtual reality (VR) technology to revolutionize construction education and training. The research focused on developing immersive VR training modules that allow construction workers to practice safety protocols and develop technical skills in a risk-free virtual environment. The project included the development of realistic construction site simulations and assessment tools for training effectiveness.
objectives: Develop comprehensive MR for DfMA based BIM implementation in factory
Create immersive and realistic learning experiences for workers
Evaluate effectiveness of MR training compared to traditional methods
outcomes: Achieved 40% improvement in safety knowledge retention
Trained 200+ construction workers using VR platform
Established partnerships with 3 construction training institutes
publications: Virtual Reality Applications in Construction Safety Training (2022)
Effectiveness of Immersive Learning in Construction Education (2022)
research_projects.impact: Medium - Improved construction safety training methods
